main.java.servers

Class MoveServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.servers.MoveServer

  • public class MoveServer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple, single-threaded echo server with sequential servicing of clients. That is, when a client connects, it is serviced to completion before another client connection can be accepted. The server cannot be stopped gracefully: use Ctrl-C to break the running program in a terminal. "Echo server" means that it listens for a connection (on a user-specifiable port), reads in the input on the wire, modifies the information, and writes the modified information back to the client, echoing the input it was given.
    Author:
    Dale MacDonald, Brian Ladd

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveServer

        public MoveServer(int portNumber,
          java.lang.String machineName,
          java.lang.String playerName)
        Creates a new TCPServer instance. TCPServer is a listening echo server (it responds with a slightly modified version of the same message it was sent).
        Parameters:
        portNumber - required port number where the server will listen.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        Parameters:
        args - a String value

      • run

        public void run()
        Primary method of the server: Opens a listening socket on the given port number (specified when the object was constructed). It then loops forever, accepting connections from clients. When a client connects, it is assumed to be sending messages, one per line. The server will process

        cout - the Output Stream for the MoveServer to the GameClient.

        public void weGotACheater(java.lang.String clientMessage,
                 java.io.PrintStream sout,
                 java.util.Scanner sin)
        Boots the player from the MoveServer's list of opponents and updates its logical and (if needed) graphical board.
        Parameters:
        clientMessage - String containing the player being booted.
        sout - Output Stream from MoveServer to GameClient.
        sin - Input Stream from GameClient to MoveServer.
